seller_description: Material Stainless Steel Color Silver Finish Type Brushed Brand Secura Item Weight 1.2 Pounds Product Dimensions 11'L x 4.92'W Is Customizable No Manufacturer Secura UPC 638339650261 791507556502 638339651282 Number of Items 1 See less. About this item: Rechargeable Electric Wine Bottle Opener - Easily remove corks in seconds. Compatible with most wine bottle sizes. Open up to 30 bottles on a single charge. Easy to Use - Simply place on top of your wine bottle, press a button, and tada, your wine is open and ready to serve. Small Footprint Saves Space - Our electric wine bottle opener is small enough to store discreetly away when not in use. Keep the charging base next to your wine fridge, storage rack, credenza, etc. Makes an Amazing Present - An elegant color makes our electric wine bottle opener an attractive present, or use it at home, when catering, at banquets, in restaurants or behind the bar. Reliable product and service - 100-240V wide input voltage range covers The known voltages of most places in the world. We offer 12 months and friendly customer service. NOTE: Please charge your wine opener every three months when not in regular use
review: This is the first review I have ever submitted on Amazon but this is the worst wine opener I have ever used! CORK SCREW DOES NOT GO DOWN CENTER OF CORK, IT JUST CHEWS UP THE SIDE! I have had other brands over the years but this one had a lot of good reviews so I thought I would try it. Not every time, but most of the time the cork screw goes off to the side and just chews the cork up and doesn't go down far enough to even pull cork out. Leaves a mess that falls into the wine bottle. Make another choice
expected-output: Seller's Image and Description: The seller's image shows a minimalistic, open-shelf rack with four fabric shelves and a basic, lightweight structure. The design is modern and functional, fitting the description of "sleek and modern" as stated by the seller. The dimensions are listed as 58 cm in length, 28 cm in width, and 72 cm in height, which suggests it is suitable for compact storage needs. The seller also notes that the product requires assembly and does not come with a warranty. This communicates the basic expectations about durability and maintenance. Buyer's Image: The buyer's image shows a similar storage rack with a fabric cover that encloses the unit. This additional cover was not mentioned in the seller's description, which may lead to some confusion about the product’s appearance if it was not advertised with the cover. The buyer’s setup appears compact, matching the intended dimensions and structure described by the seller, indicating that the core product is consistent with the seller’s image. Buyer's Review: The buyer expresses satisfaction, stating they are "very happy" with the product and found the assembly straightforward. The review mentions using it to store kitchen essentials and highlights that it complements their decor, indicating that the product met or even exceeded their expectations regarding appearance and functionality. Comparison and Conclusion: Visual Appearance: The primary difference between the seller and buyer images is the fabric cover seen in the buyer’s photo, which was not shown or described in the seller’s image. However, this doesn’t appear to have impacted the buyer's satisfaction. Functional Alignment: The buyer found the assembly straightforward and the product sturdy, aligning well with the seller’s claims about the product’s functionality and ease of use. Buyer Satisfaction: The buyer is clearly satisfied, as evidenced by the positive review, praising both the appearance and the functionality of the rack. There is no indication of disappointment or unmet expectations. Final Assessment: There are no significant discrepancies between the seller's promises and the buyer's experience. The product met the buyer's needs and aligned well with the description. While there was a minor visual variation with the cover, it did not affect the buyer's satisfaction. In this case, neither the seller nor the buyer is at fault, as the product fully met the buyer’s expectations. The buyer's positive feedback suggests that the product performs as advertised, fulfilling the seller's description effectively.
label: 1:Here buyer agreed with the seller
